name: fiddlehead
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the curly end of some young ferns (= green plants with long stems, leaves like feathers, and no flowers), sometimes cooked and eaten as a vegetable: Fiddleheads are good fried in butter with a little garlic. I ordered a fiddlehead salad with noodles. See also
fiddlehead fern
ostrich fern
More examplesFewer examplesThe fiddleheads of certain ferns are eaten as a cooked leaf vegetable.Make sure you wash your fiddleheads thoroughly before cooking.First of all, she boiled the fiddleheads quickly in salted water and then drained them.He added the fiddleheads to the hot pan and cooked them on a high heat.The season is short, as fiddlehead ferns are only available for about two weeks.
